Sentencas: 3D modeling for fuel cells is generally computationally expensive, especially for stacks.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: In order to reduce computational cost, spatial smoothing over the parallel plain channels in flow fields is introduced and applied to a 3D steady-state isothermal planar solid oxide fuel cell model, which is validated with experiment from literature.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The 3D model is reduced to 2D coupled with effective parameters and correlation factors, and then asymptotically reduced to parabolic PDEs and ODEs associated with space marching.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The correlation factors, which are derived based on a full set of governing equations for electrokenitics over a cell cross section, can handle not only variations in diffusion pathways due to ribs but also the coupling effect between governing equations.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The reduced models are verified with the 3D counterpart in view of global and local properties.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Good agreement with a quantitative loss of information is achieved.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: The reduction in computational cost is investigated.
Titulo: Reduced model for the planar solid oxide fuel cell
